oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mt. Lebanon Baptist: fieldnotes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fieldnotes of Mt. Lebanon Baptist Church. Notes document the construction materials, basic architectural elements, brief history, and location of the church.

Mt. Lebanon Baptist Church has Reconstruction era roots, dating back to its construction in 1869. The original frame building was replaced with a brick structure in 1954. At the time of documentation (May 15, 1998), the church was situated within a black neighborhood south of downtown Camden. Larry C. Jackson served as pastor at that time and the church.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
